JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE , while undergoing training at the SU-CARDINAL company , the applicant had an accident . As a result of this accident he was classed as a disabled person .

CARDINAL . Starting in DATE the applicant instituted CARDINAL sets of proceedings against the Vinnitsa specialised collective company no . CARDINAL ( “ the company ” ) , the successor of the company responsible for the accident , in the GPE ORG of FAC ( “ ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the company , seeking a ruling to oblige the company to provide him with a wheelchair for home use and a wheelchair for outside use . The applicant also claimed compensation for non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . By its judgment of DATE ORG ordered the company to provide the applicant with CARDINAL wheelchairs . It also partly allowed the applicant 's claim for compensation . By an additional judgment of DATE ORG amended its previous judgment and ruled that the company should provide the applicant with all components for wheelchairs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the above judgments and remitted the case for a new consideration to ORG . The applicant appealed in cassation . In the period from DATE the ORG mainly examined the admissibility of the applicant 's appeal in cassation against the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant 's appeal in cassation was sent to ORG . On DATE the latter dismissed it .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE no hearings were scheduled .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE ORG scheduled some QUANTITY hearings , QUANTITY of them were adjourned on account of absence of the company 's representative , CARDINAL other on account of the judge 's absence . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned since the applicant 's representative failed to appear .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE no hearings were held .

CARDINAL . In the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings . CARDINAL of them were adjourned because the judge was involved in other proceedings and CARDINAL on account of his illness . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned because the ORG 's representative failed to appear , CARDINAL due to the absence of the company 's representative .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to another judge .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE ORG scheduled some CARDINAL hearings , CARDINAL of them were adjourned since the judge was ill and one because he was involved in other hearings .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG left the applicant 's claim without consideration . The applicant in his submissions alleged that he learned about that decision from the Government 's observations sent to him in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the company . The applicant claimed nursery allowance and compensation for non - pecuniary damage caused to him by the company .
CARDINAL . The first hearing was held on DATE . On unspecified dates the prosecutor and ORG of ORG ( “ Fund ” ) joined the proceedings .

CARDINAL . According to the records provided by the Government , of around CARDINAL listed hearings CARDINAL were adjourned since the ORG 's representative failed to appear . On CARDINAL occasions the hearings were adjourned as the prosecutor failed to appear . QUANTITY hearings were adjourned since the judge was involved in other proceedings and CARDINAL on account of the judge 's illness . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned since the applicant or his representative failed to appear or at their request . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned because of the absence of the company 's representative or at his request .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the applicant 's claim without consideration . The applicant in his submissions alleged that he learned about that decision from the Government 's observations which were sent to him in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with the ORG challenging the actions of the head of the company . He alleged that the latter had unlawfully refused to send him for a medical examination in order to establish that he needed anti - bedsore treatment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the judge sitting in his case . On DATE ORG dismissed his request . The applicant appealed . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings , CARDINAL of them were adjourned at the company 's request . The applicant challenged a judge sitting in his case on several occasions . On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE his requests were granted and the case was transferred to another judge .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor joined the proceeding . On an unspecified date the ORG joined the proceedings as a third party .
CARDINAL . There were no hearings scheduled DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . Out of around CARDINAL hearings listed in the period from CARDINAL DATE to CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned because the ORG 's representative failed to appear . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned due to the absence , or at the request , of the applicant or his representative . On QUANTITY occasions the judge failed to appear because he was ill , on QUANTITY occasions since he was involved in other proceedings , and on CARDINAL occasion as he was on holiday . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned because the company 's representative failed to appear or at his request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to another judge .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG left the applicant 's claim without consideration . The applicant submitted that he had learned about that decision from the Government 's observations sent to him in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the company . He challenged the company 's refusal to provide him with bedclothes and claimed compensation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left his claim without consideration due to its procedural shortcomings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the ruling of DATE and remitted the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant 's claim . The company appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal in cassation against the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the ORG joined the proceedings as a third party .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings . CARDINAL of them were adjourned due to absence of the ORG 's representative . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned since the applicant or his representative failed to appear or at their request . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned as the judge was on holiday , CARDINAL since he was involved in other proceedings and CARDINAL on account of the judge 's illness . QUANTITY hearings were adjourned since the company 's representative failed to appear or at his request .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG left the applicant 's claim without consideration . The applicant in his submissions stated that he had learned about that decision from the Government 's observations sent to him in DATE .
